p: The peaks 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, and 9 were identified as flavan-3-ol derivatives. The main fragments found were yielded from Retro-Diels-Alder (RDA) fragmentation (losses of 152 u) followed by dehydration (losses of 170 u), as well as the fragments related to catechin/epicatechin in monomeric form [ 29]. These peaks also showed compatible UV ( λmax ≈ 277–280 nm), and were identified as procyanidin dimers B type (peaks 1 and 9), procyanidin trimer A and B type (peaks 3, 4 and 5), and procyanidin tetramer B type (peak 6). The B- and A-type proanthocyanidins with the same composition of flavan-3-ol units presented mass differences of 2 u. The A-type procyanidins were formed by 4→8 C–C bond and an interflavonoid C–O bond, and in B type by 4→8 or 4→6 C–C bonds between flavan-3-ol monomers [ 32].
